topic.title: Password protected proxy?
topic.body:
I am running a zeronet node accessible from a non-standard outside port as a personal proxy when I am away from home.  Is it possible to password protect my proxy?

Thanks

topic.title: "Forbidden: Media referrer error" on SSL Nginx Proxy
topic.body:
I'm attempting to set up an SSL HTTPS nginx proxy with password protection so I can access zeronet from my mobile devices while I'm on the road.

I have set up nginx on Ubuntu 16.04 with LetsEncrypt SSL certs according to http://www.htpcguides.com/secure-nginx-reverse-proxy-with-lets-encrypt-on-ubuntu-16-04-lts/

Unfortunately, once I get the proxy up and running, any access results in ZeroNet reporting a "Forbidden: Media referrer error".  I assume it doesn't like the proxy referral?

Any help appreciated, including any working configs.  Does anyone run ZeroNet behind an SSL proxy?

Thanks!

1_1Buu3gEo6EcUijPE6dkSToaYzXKGnAgXFy.body: Thanks.  I was hoping to avoid running a reverse proxy, but I guess it is not that big a deal.

2_1Buu3gEo6EcUijPE6dkSToaYzXKGnAgXFy.body: Nice welcoming attitude towards a new user of a small community trying to contribute.

@devtest, thank you.  I will take a look when I get back in town and post my experience.

@ancap how do you know I'm not trying to contribute?  I have professional crypto design experience and have started several open source projects.  I have obviously devoted hours to my interest in zeronet already.  A more welcoming tone would help grow the community faster, I might have written it off if not for devtest's response.
